body.p: You can run the installation in unattended mode by running the installer executable from the command line and passing the -q parameter.

In unattended mode, the installer does not overwrite files with the same name if a previous version of the is installed in the same folder. The -overwrite parameter added after the -q parameter forces the overwriting of these files.
To display a console for the unattended installation, add a -console parameter to the command line.

section.title: Custom Settings in Unattended Installation
section.p: An unattended installation applies the default installation settings. It is equivalent to running the regular installer and making no changes to options.
If you want to install on a large number of computers, you may want to change the default values of some settings such as:

li.p: whether a desktop icon or a quick launch shortcut is created
the file associations created in the operating system
the name of the program group on the Start menu
any other setting available through the installer

section.p: To change these defaults for an unattended install, create a settings file. To generate the settings file, run the installer in normal attended mode and specify the exact options that you want for the unattended installation. When the installation is completed, look for a file called response.varfile in the .install4jfolder inside the directory where is installed. This file contains the setting you chose during the installtion. To apply these options for an unattended install, specify this file in the command line.
